snippet: Some current and former employees of the museum in Crown Heights say it is shifting from its middle-class patrons and is chasing newer, wealthier residents.
abstract: Some current and former employees of Brooklyn Children's Museum, as well as some elected officials, are questioning new initiatives that they say abandon museum's roots of serving working- and middle-class patrons and instead catering to wealthier clientele; cast blame on rapid gentrification of Crown Heights neighborhood and nearby communities.
lead_paragraph: Some current and former employees of the museum in Crown Heights say it is shifting from its middle-class patrons and is chasing newer, wealthier residents.

headline.main: With Expansion, Brooklyn Children’s Museum Is Accused of Forsaking Its Community
headline.print_headline: Expanding, and Talk of Outgrowing Roots
